results.title: Go now
results.creator_credit: Revolution Studios, Andrew Eaton, David M. Thompson and Michael Winterbottom
results.brief_description: Tackling the themes of chronic illness and relationships this relatively early work from Michael Winterbottom chronicles a young man’s path from an affable lucky-in-love bloke, to an irascible invalid. Along the way he tests the patience of his loyal girlfriend as he struggles to come to grips with the disease, his diminished physicality and his place within his working class milieu as man who does not work, and who, at a young age, faces an uncertain future. Wonderful plebeian Scottish brogue by screenplay writers Paul Henry Powell and Jimmy McGovern.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Revolution Studios, Andrew Eaton, David M. Thompson and Michael Winterbottom

results.title: Go for it!
results.creator_credit: Barwon Youth Employment Office for the Employment Access Program, Community Services Victoria and Clayton Jacobson
results.brief_description: A program aimed at young disadvantaged youth in the labour market, particularly those attending Youth Training Centres, Youth Welfare Services, living in hostels or in the care and custody of Community Services Victoria. Highlights young people succeeding in various jobs and through interviews discusses how they found employment, their expectations and experiences in the workforce.

results.title: Go for gold
results.creator_credit: Crystal Productions, Tom Hubbard and Dick Durrance
results.brief_description: An instructional film for the recreational racer. Former US Olympic coach Bob Beattie explains basic ski-racing techniques as pro-racers demonstrate ski preparation, the start, running the gates, and the finish. Accentuates key points in racing as pro-racers and top recreational skiers run the National Standard Race: NASTAR. Suitable for secondary and tertiary levels.

results.title: Go fish
results.creator_credit: Can I Watch Pictures, Islet, KVPI, Rose Troche and Guinevere Turner
results.brief_description: Shot in black and white, on a low budget and using a predominantly non-professional cast, Rose Troche’s first feature offers an inside view of lesbian life in the ‘90’s. Max is looking for love, Ely suffers from a long distance relationship and their scheming friends are determined to match them. Navigated by a wistful narration, the film tracks the inter-linked cast of characters from cafes and bookshops to dinner parties, dates and sex. Starring Guinevere Turner, V. S. Brodie, T. Wendy McMillan, Migdalia Melendez and Anastasia Sharp. Screenplay by Rose Troche and Guinevere Turner.

results.title: Go dream a kite
results.brief_description: Set in Toronto, Canada, this film tells the tale of two young children who have worked hard selling lemonade and cutting grass in order to buy a special kite. When they finally earn enough money the kite has already been sold.
results.description: Set in Toronto, Canada, this film tells the tale of two young children who have worked hard selling lemonade and cutting grass in order to buy a special kite. When they finally earn enough money the kite has already been sold.

results.title: Go Between. My Name Is Asher Lev
results.brief_description: Designed for senior students of English, this programme features a lecture on the “The Go-between”, by L.P. Hartley, and “My name is Asher Lev” by Chaim Potok. Critical issues and significant passages are discussed.

results.title: Go Bang – PNAU
results.brief_description: Australian dance act PNAU are celebrated for groundbreaking visuals in their live act and music videos, including for their single Go Bang (2017) which featured Kira Divine. The clip creates a psychedelic, cosmic journey through animation, the glow-in-the-dark effects and an aquatic aesthetic.

constellations_primary.name: Go Bang
constellations_primary.description: Australian dance act PNAU are renowned for groundbreaking visuals in their music videos, including for their 2017 single 'Go Bang' which featured Kira Divine.

results.description: Australian dance act PNAU are celebrated for groundbreaking visuals in their live act and music videos, including for their single ‘Go Bang’, which featured Kira Divine. Setting out to create a psychedelic, cosmic journey through the use of animation, the glow-in-the-dark effects and aquatic aesthetic conjure images of James Cameron’s Avatar and the introduction of singing crab Tamatoa in Disney’s Moana.
description_for_label: Australian dance act PNAU are celebrated for groundbreaking visuals in their live act and music videos, including for their single ‘Go Bang’, which featured Kira Divine. Setting out to create a psychedelic, cosmic journey through the use of animation, the glow-in-the-dark effects and aquatic aesthetic conjure images of James Cameron’s Avatar and the introduction of singing crab Tamatoa in Disney’s Moana.
